website_summaries.verdict: A solid and durable sewing machine with all you need to keep going. And it's portable, too, weighing just 12 lbs.
pros: This machine allows you to choose from 18 stitches
It has a top-loading jam-proof bobbin system and includes a 4-step buttonhole with balance adjuster
The accompanying book is full of helpful tips and notes
cons: Some users find this machine struggles with thick material

customer_reviews.title: I'm so glad I did
customer_reviews.text: I've been eyeing this one for years and finally gave up my cheaper computerized one to get it. I'm so glad I did! It took a bit to adjust to the non-automatic features but the quality of my stitches and work is now so much better! It still has the drop in bobbin and winder. I do miss the down needle function and automatic theater but I can live without it. Dropped off a star for this reasons, doesn't come with a cover, and the light can get warm overall, I'm very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet.
customer_reviews.text: This is a little work horse. I began sewing in March 2016, and have been using this machine 4 to 6 days a week! It'' still going strong, works awesome with light, medium, and semi heavy fabric. I make medical scrub tops, purses, and household items.
customer_reviews.author: Ceeh

customer_reviews.title: Great first impressions
customer_reviews.text: I did A LOT of research before deciding on this machine. I was specifically looking for a good quality beginner machine. I didn't need to many bells and whistles but wanted to be able to do some good quality stitches. Just received this machine a week ago and found it extremely easy to set up and use straight out of the box. The bonus extras are also great to have in my sewing drawer. Will update this review with further use, but first impressions are really great.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, cheap plastic machine.
customer_reviews.text: This machine was a complete disappointment. It is loud, has a crappy light, and struggled to go over several layers of fabric. Plus, it is grossly overpriced at $300!!! It really is no different than the crappy singer plastic machine I had 15 years ago. am a very experienced sewer and wanted a basic machine that could sew multiple layers to make masks with during our Covid outbreak. I plan on returning it and getting something else.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel A. Eager

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginner. Perfect for intermediate.
customer_reviews.text: Reviewing on behalf of my spouse: This is a perfect machine for a new sewer. This is a perfect machine for a sewer to grow into over time. It even meets the high standards of the grandmother who's been sewing for almost 60 years. We bought it for the granddaughter as a first machine, but hope it will serve her for years. Highly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: George H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have a shared account. He has not used this sewing machine, but I have. I have made several covers for our new headboard, one was a furry fabric and the other was a polyester fleece. I had no trouble with either fabric. In fact, I haven't felt so much power in a sewing machine, since I used my mothers old 1931 Singer. It has many more stitches than I will ever use, but I'm glad I purchased this heavy duty sewing machine, as I believe I will have it for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Joe S

customer_reviews.title: Great, simple but packed with good features machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine! I had an old Sears that didn't do anything but sew basic stuff. I've gotten better at sewing and wanted something that would sew different stitches and go thru heavier material. This machine is simple, portable, yet very sturdy on it's own. It would be a good machine tho for a beginner. It's not complicated at all. I love the feet I can buy for it to hem. Hate pinning and this does the trick without having to have a serger. Great machine and I got it at a very good price here.
customer_reviews.author: Treker

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a second sewing machine that would easily handle multiple layers of fabrics, heavier fabrics, and machine quilting projects - this machine does the trick! Optional accessories (ie presser feet, etc...)are readily available and reasonably priced. This machine is a valuable addition to my sewing room.
customer_reviews.author: Tyra L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful machine for all ages.
customer_reviews.text: It took me awhile getting to it because of just life stuff, but, i trusted the reviews about how wonderful this little machine was and oh my, yes, the smoothness is awesome, I have never experienced this in my whole life of sewing and so many stitches this machine can just go. The threading feels so confident that it won't come apart when you sew. The bobbin can hold much more thread and in all I love it. I can't wait to get back to sewing now. I want to sew things more. Thank you for the reviews and tutorials.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M Adkins

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I've had other Jenome machines before. I gave them away as I thought I was finished with sewing. I bought this one and I'm going to keep it forever. For the brand, it's an inexpensive machine as other sell for a lit more, yet it sews like an expensive one. It is sturdy and sews wonderful. I'm do glad I got it
customer_reviews.author: Deseree

customer_reviews.title: Lemon of a machine. Want refund
customer_reviews.text: Bought this machine 1 1/2 months ago. Machine was hardly used by me. It now has a loud grinding noise and it sounds like the gears are slipping on the inside of the machine, and not working properly. I have changed thread changed needles changed bobbins. And it still has the loud grinding noise and still sounds like it's gears are slipping. I tried to contact seller and amazon. No one has gotten back to me yet. I want to return machine for a refund. I paid with shipping, $369.00. And of course you can only send things back within 30 days. So, I'm stuck with a lame sewing machine that doesn't work. Very upset what do I do?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... had this machine several years now and I absolutely love it. Good basic machine and sews through thicker ...
customer_reviews.text: Have had this machine several years now and I absolutely love it. Good basic machine and sews through thicker fabrics with no problem. No case is provided so I use a plastic zipper bedding bag that I got a quilt in, works great. This Janome is really a pleasure to use. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Good Sewing Machine
customer_reviews.text: I had a Kenmore for 45 years, and it finally stopped working -- probably because I didn't take care of it. I got the Janome based solely on the reviews. I had never heard of this brand. From day one, the Janome has been a terrific sewing machine. The instructions are very easy to follow and the sewing quality is perfect. It is lightweight, the bobbin is easy to load and unload, changing pressor feet is a breeze, and the dual post bobbin winder is convenient. I did have some felting that I wanted to put together, but it was too thick for the Janome. Other than that, it has been excellent in every aspect.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cleveland

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I've used my new machine several times now. I'm very pleased with my purchase. I highly recommend this brand and model for the casual sewer.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: Great sewing machine super smooth a little loud but works great easy to clean I’ve already put 200 hours on it and can’t wait to sew more!
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 years later I'm buying another sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: I sew, but not that often. Regardless, 2.5 years later and I'm looking for another sewing machine. This one was good but not the foot wont stay up and it sounds like a jackhammer. lol.
customer_reviews.author: xboom

customer_reviews.title: Unbreakable
customer_reviews.text: I am not a beginner at all, have been sewing for over 30 years, but I bought this mashine because it has a metal core and does not have all the computer stuff in it. The stitching is perfect. I enjoy working on it.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria W

customer_reviews.title: I received this machine quickly and in good order. After brief use it is working well
customer_reviews.text: I received this machine quickly and in good order. After brief use it is working well. I will update later. I have not used a machine for many years, but the instructions were sufficient to wind a bobbin and thread the machine. Have only worked on one simple project so far. I found it helpful to watch a YouTube video for placing the bobbin and drawing the bobbin thread up.
customer_reviews.author: Janie E. Epstein

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sewing machine!
customer_reviews.text: I love this sewing machine! It’s very simple to use and has a beautiful straight stitch. I’m looking forward to trying all the stitches and all the features on this machine. It was very well packaged to send through the mail. Many thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for basic sewing
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Janome Magnolia! It is so easy to use, and there is also an easy-to-understand instruction manual. Many years ago I was an intermediate to advanced seamstress, and am now taking up the hobby again. The Janome Magnolia is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Love love love this machine
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this machine! Have done regular straight stitching with it, zigzag pattern, and blind hemming so far. Love all the manual controls, and the owner guide is really easy to follow and has been perfect to get me up and going. Easy bobbin winding and install, the light is bright enough to see my work, and all the accessories have been great!
customer_reviews.author: Anya Lagasse

customer_reviews.title: This machine is quite remarkable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine for my daughter-in-law so she could learn to sew. It is easy to use, offers enough features and sews beautifully. This is an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Ann

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and powerful !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine to replace a old Singer machine. This past Christmas I made 9 quilts as gifts for family and a few military moms. This machine is very smooth and runs flawlessly. Excellent for a beginner like me as well as for my experienced 79 year old mom. She found it to be very similar to her trusty old Singer but lighter and more compact.
customer_reviews.author: christopher sawicki

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to use as you think.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I had read that it was a beginners sewing machine but after following complete directions on threading and everything, it keeps jamming. I have watched every video on how to thread correctly and I can't figure out how it keeps jamming. This should be easy but it's not. I am not having to take the sewing machine to my daughter's sewing teacher to see if she can figure out what I am doing wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Laine

customer_reviews.title: Love this sewing machine!
customer_reviews.text: Love this sewing machine!! I haven't sewn since I was a teenager (I'm 45 now), so it's great for returning to sewing. The machine runs very quietly and smoothly. I was a little worried that the flowers would be too kid like, but I actually like them. I think I read every review out there, and I'm so glad I settled on this machine. Shopping was VERY speedy!
customer_reviews.author: sawpad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Machine
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my old machine (a Singer) and it's a great machine, easy to use, and I've had no problems with it. I prefer the non-electronic machines and didn't want to go with Singer again since their machines aren't what they used to be. I highly recommend this machine. Great for beginners and experienced Seamstresses alike.
customer_reviews.author: fransisca27

customer_reviews.title: Happy happy kid!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sewing machine from a ten year old girls Christmas list. I found a review on The Sweet Home site. They used different machines by people who actually sew (we don't) and I liked HOW they did the testing. I thought it would be better to buy a real machine instead of a (toy machine) as I didn't want her to have disappointing results as a beginner. Haven't had it long though but so far, we're happy. The Janome 7318 came ready to go with pretty good instructions. She has made with some supervision, about five projects so far. The results were pretty impressive. Shipping was on time and it was packaged properly.
customer_reviews.author: Dusty Larkin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: After doing a lot of research, I settled on the Janome Magnolia model. I do a lot of home projects but do not need anything computerized. I wanted a basic model with some of the bells and whistles but really just a machine that sewed well and did not have the tension problems I was experiencing with an older machine I'd had. So far so good! Very pleased with this purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: totallycrazymolly

customer_reviews.title: Singer 9960
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this machine! Get it, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm

customer_reviews.title: A great machine!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine when my entry-level Singer started acting up. I've had it for a month now, and have no complaints. This machine is a workhorse so far. Straight out of the box, the pressure in the presser foot is perfect, and it doesn't complain when I sew multiple layers. One of my complaints with my last machine was the inconsistency of stitch length, and with this machine, you won't need to worry. No matter how fast you sew, the stitch length remains the same. Set-up is very easy. The machine was not damaged in shipping and arrived earlier than expected. Overall, I'm very pleased with my purchase and I anticipate many years of happy sewing.
customer_reviews.author: JME

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Machine!
customer_reviews.text: I love this sewing machine! it sews beautifully and sews perfect stitches! It has all the stitches I need. I did not regret buying this machine, it looks sturdy and the motor is powerful. I am still a beginner but I find It very easy to use. After I took it out of the box, I started sewing immediately without having any problems at all. The price is reasonable, too! If you want a strong/sturdy machine yet affordable, I highly recommend this Janome Magnolia 7318!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie B. Diola

customer_reviews.title: If a needle threader is important to you beware there is no needle threader on this machine.
customer_reviews.text: This machine sewed very nice but there is no needle threader and the dials are difficult to turn. I will have to return it and search for an easier machine.
customer_reviews.author: otisschell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Built solid. I would highly recommend it to people who wants to buy a sewing machine that lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki Caesar

customer_reviews.title: perfect for a newbie!
customer_reviews.text: this is my first ever sewing machine. I took lessons a week before i started using this. I have never used a sewing machine before and found this very user friendly. This is perfect for newbie! There are cheaper sewing machines out there, but i wanted something that's sturdy, reliable and that will last awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry NYC

customer_reviews.title: Good little workhorse.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Solidly built! Will try not to drop the feed dog as many reviews have pointed out.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for beginners!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Janome! I am teaching myself how to sew and it is going so well with the Janome. I had a cheaper machine and it was so fustrating and confusing. This machine is so user friendly for a beginner. For a machine in this price range you cannot ask for anything more. I would highly recommand. Read the manual and get to know your machine.
customer_reviews.author: DrCassie2k7

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used it a lot. But for what ever I have used. I am liking it
customer_reviews.author: SS

customer_reviews.title: Janome Magnolia 7318
customer_reviews.text: Love it love it love it. I wanted a NON electronic machine with a bobbin that drops in from the top and that wouldn't require me to have an engineering degree. The Magnolia is quiet, sews like a dream and I'm a very happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Ida A.

customer_reviews.title: Fine machine
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had the chance to use it a lot yet, but my initial reaction is that it is a fine machine and meets all my expectations. I had not had a new sewing machine in over 40 years so as part of my research I called a friend and former Home Ec teacher and avid quilter. She told me she had 3 Janomes and 3 ladies she knew had the Magnolia and all loved theirs. That sealed the deal for me. I have found it to be an uncomplicated and basic machine, easy to use and lightweight. I look forward to some fun projects soon.
customer_reviews.author: C.D.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expected. Solid basic machine. Does all I need.
customer_reviews.author: lawrence pohl

customer_reviews.title: Love love love it
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good about this machine. It is easy to use, easy to trouble shoot, sews like a dream. It's nice and quiet, not too noisy at all. Love it so much, my sister in law just bought one too :)
customer_reviews.author: CMC5

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: my wife has only used it twice, but she likes it
customer_reviews.author: L M

customer_reviews.title: Review of purchase
customer_reviews.text: Really like this machine, however, my old machine when using the reverse lever it would stay up on its own. On the Janome I have to hold it in place while trying to feed the fabric while sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine
customer_reviews.text: Good price. Enough versatility. Excellent value for low-intermediate users who sew a little every now and then. Quiet, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great machine for the price...
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Janome's and still do... I bought this as an upgrade for our 11 year old son who was sewing with the Hello Kitty Janome.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa A Lively

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My order came on time and without any issues. The packaging is well prepared and everything is in place. No missing parts or accessories. I love working on this machine. For a beginner like me, it comes quite handy and very useful. I just wish it came with a hard cover for safekeeping purposes.
customer_reviews.author: zzmbergmom

customer_reviews.title: Magnolia great machine for piecing quilts and is easily portable
customer_reviews.text: Magnolia is lighter weight for transport. Sewing machine runs so smoothly and sound level is not too noisy. Had to learn to drop the needle before stitching and to hold the threads toward the back so the machine did not jam. I am very happy with my purchase. However, learned Janome doe not honor the warranty unless you purchase machine from a Janome dealer.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Janome Magnolia 7318
customer_reviews.text: The shipping was extremely fast and the machine was well-packaged. I really love all the stitch functions and how easy it is to switch between functions. The drop-in bobbin is very easy to use and I really like being able to see how low the bobbin thread is without having to take the whole case apart. This is a very easy-to-use machine and is very well-made and styled!
customer_reviews.author: WA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Singer that was falling apart literally. When I brought it to a sewing class, the instructor recommended this Janome Magnolia. I've had the Janome Magnolia for 3 weeks, and she purrs like a BMW! Smooth, easy to change bobbins,and labeled buttons and knobs!
customer_reviews.author: STEFANIE

customer_reviews.title: Great Basic Machine
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it. It is very easy to use out of the box and seems to be built very well.
customer_reviews.author: Nebraskan

customer_reviews.title: Good sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: This sewing machine runs so smoothly & is easy to use. Very simple! It takes care of all my needs like sewing clothes. The only thing is it runs slower than I thought but still works well
customer_reviews.author: Sred

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Im newbie on sewing and have been busy with projects since i got janome 7318. I love its simplicity and its build, it does not feel cheap, easy to use and not too loud. One minor problem was solved over the phone with the suplier. Very recommended.
customer_reviews.author: AWP2005

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: Gift for my daughter. She loves it and has used it several times already!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Happy wife Happy life! She is very satisfied with my purchase for her.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A nice machine at a great price
customer_reviews.text: My second janome. A nice machine at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Crm

customer_reviews.title: Great starter sewing machine.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a starter machine for a 12 year old. She loves the machine and says it was easy to use. She read the instruction manual cover to cover and loves the flowers on the front of the machine. She can thread the machine, insert the bobbin, wind the bobbin and sew away after following the instructions in the book. I love that this is such an easy, hassle free machine for a first machine. It helps beginners to want to keep sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah J Kelly

customer_reviews.title: It seems to be up to my needs. I ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to be up to my needs. I do wish I had more choices of pre-set stitches. However for the price, this is adequate,\.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita  Coffelt

customer_reviews.title: GREAT for beginners and intermediates
customer_reviews.text: Great machine for beginners! Relatively quiet, very fast, and easy to learn how to use! However, I quickly outgrew this machine because I started wanting to do elaborate stitches, and this machine only has 18 stitch options (if I remember correctly). Also, the tension can easily get disturbed and it pulls too much on the top thread (constantly causing the thread to slip out of the needle).
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Tu

customer_reviews.title: love the Mangnolia 7318
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it once so far and it was to sew a backpack and it did great. It sews even stitches and very smoothly. I got it because my sister has one and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Inspector5_2

customer_reviews.title: High quality machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sewing machine when my beginner Singer finally bit the dust, and I couldn't be happier with it. It sews beautifully and has more stitches than I've even been able to learn. The only downside is that it does rattle a bit when it's running at full speed, but this hasn't affected the quality of the stitches at all.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine but light bulb gets hot
customer_reviews.text: My only concern with this machine is that the light bulb gets incredibly hot rather quickly. It could be a fire hazard, especially if it comes in contact with highly flammable material. Also, because it sits right above the needle, it radiates a lot of heat, and could even burn you if you're not careful. I have never had this problem with other machines.
customer_reviews.author: trisha ola

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up and use
customer_reviews.text: My first sewing machine...easy to set up and use. Was making quality stitches and seams in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen R.

customer_reviews.title: I'm very pleased with my Janome Magnolia
customer_reviews.text: OMG! what a difference! from my previous sewing machine! this one is so delightful to do my projects! I'm very pleased with my Janome Magnolia!
customer_reviews.author: Eliane

customer_reviews.title: I don't think this machine is quiet at all
customer_reviews.text: My most recent machines are a Singer ProFinish Serger, A 1940's Singer, Viking Designer I, 1990's Brother, and now this one. It is a present for my 8 yr old daughters birthday. Maybe I just got a lemon or something but the motor sounds awful in between certain speeds. Usually the speeds that my daughter and I sew at the most. It goes away at higher speeds when my daughters says she 'gets a speeding ticket'. I don't think its quiet at all, however i am satisfied with the stitching. I used it to patch my husbands work pants, 3 layers of heavy material and besides lack of work space the machine sewed fine.
customer_reviews.author: acithacany

customer_reviews.title: the sillence
customer_reviews.text: this machine has all the atributes of an old fashioned sewing machine with more modern benefits.the stitching is perfection and there is so little sound that you are lulled into a sence of enjoyment!
customer_reviews.author: scarlet

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I'm a total beginner. It's easy to use. Instructions are clear. I am happy with this machine.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have been sewing on my machine for about three weeks. I love it! I have not sewn for many years, and this is the perfect machine to get started on again!
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn Pollman

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My daughter need a sewing machine for school and we bought this one after much research. She uses it several times a week and has had it for 4 months now. It has worked flawlessly for her. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: I love it and would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: This machine is easy to thread, sews smoothly, and sews on heavy weight fabric with ease. I would purchase it again.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy Arp

customer_reviews.title: When it arrived bobbin was loose so it was fun figuring out what was wrong with it and then ...
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived bobbin was loose so it was fun figuring out what was wrong with it and then trying to fix it. Otherwise, I'm a beginner and think it is a good machine.
customer_reviews.author: Mavis

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use, lightweight and simple to move around the house, easy storage, 10/10 recommend
customer_reviews.author: Gil

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: LUV this machine. Easy to use and does what I want. Have a very expensive machine that I can't use -- too hard to operate.
customer_reviews.author: KPinTN

customer_reviews.title: Sew Much Fun
customer_reviews.text: Our Charter Club purchased this for their sewing group and I have heard no negative feedback on its use. Storage is easy and operation seems smooth.
customer_reviews.author: Property Manager 1101

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for price
customer_reviews.text: Extreme value with sturdy quality construction, sews like a dream. This machine is able to accommodate varying thickness of materials with ease. Simple threading and bobbin winding capabilities. Excellent value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Janome Magnolia 7318
customer_reviews.text: This machine is perfect for me - I'm a pretty "casual" sewer, and that's exactly what this machine is good for. The settings are simple, but there are still enough options to get creative.
customer_reviews.author: schradje

customer_reviews.title: I Like it
customer_reviews.text: I like it. It's great mashin. I don't use it long time and I don't know how it will be work. But now its very comfortably, easy and gualitatively
customer_reviews.author: Lyudmila

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far it is working for me. A few things are different than my old one.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL WATERHOUSE

customer_reviews.title: ... was a gift for my wife and she is delighted.
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my wife and she is delighted.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Moe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a Christmas gift for my daughter in law and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Welch

customer_reviews.title: I would say it's an excelent sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: I would say it's an excelent sewing machine, designwise. But as shipped it had a loose belt that I had to tighten. It made a loud thunking sound on all but the lightest faberic. Because I had read about others having loose belts I downloaded the service manual and opened it up to check out the belt. It was very loose and the screw that keeps it tight was very loose. Someone missed a step in final assembly. I tightened the belt and it now is super good.
customer_reviews.author: Laura C

customer_reviews.title: Worst Machine Ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst Machine Ever! It is much worse than my Brother $69.00 machine, for the price I spent, I wouldn't"t expect it jam the thread for every minute, eat my fabric, tear away the fabric!!!!! Very Frustrated, I would like to throw it out of the window, stay away from it!
customer_reviews.author: Jossy007

customer_reviews.title: Idk how to fix stitch
customer_reviews.text: I like so far. My problem is with the stitch the top stitch seems dragged like there is no spacing between the stitches. How do I fix that.
customer_reviews.author: Millie Laurent

customer_reviews.title: ARRIVED IN VERY BAD CONDITION
customer_reviews.text: The machine arrived and was ok to start. However after about a week the machine started to make very load noises and the tension was all messed up. I had already thrown out the box it came in and was unable to return it. I took it to my sewing machine repair man. He later told me that the whole motor was not mounted and the tension belt was not attached I spent nearly $100.00 more to have the machine work properly. I would not buy this brand again I was told that Janome was a good product. However not for me.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Fisher

customer_reviews.title: What a wast of money.
customer_reviews.text: Presser feet fall off while using, thread breaks while trying to pull out and cut off. Trying to figure out how to sell it and get a few bucks for it. Now in a box while I return to using my old Singer. Worse machine I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: S Reed

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Machine.
customer_reviews.text: I've done some COOL projects (like this hand made cloth, not felt, quiet book page! My own design! The little gnome fits inside the tree and there are fairies hiding behind grass flaps)with this thing and I LOVE IT. Janome machines are So much better than Singer
customer_reviews.author: idontwantaname

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! I sew for a living, and this is my favorite machine. It's tough, fairly quiet, and I haven't had any of the usual issues so far. ( I've had it for 3 months, and use it 18 hours a week. ) Thinking about purchasing another of these as a backup machine. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Momof8

customer_reviews.title: Janome Magnolia 7318 is a great machine.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy machine and also quiet. This is my first sewing machine and very easy to use. Button holes are easy and accurate. Stitching is straight and consistent. Plastic is not cheap and the machine feels robust. Light is very bright. Easy to thread and winding the bobbin is simple, plus the transparent bobbin cover is convenient. Changing the presser foots is simple. Feed dog works at stated. Foot pedal is big and durable. Conclusion: Very happy and recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Janome 7318
customer_reviews.text: I received the sewing machine promptly. All accessories were there. Nothing was missing. I did find the buttonholer in the drawer as described by the other reviewers. It was very easy to set up and to use. All of the reviews have been correct about the ease of operation. I did look at two YouTube videos on how to thread the machine and how to use it. The manual is also very helpful and very easy to follow. I could not be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: South Georgia Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Love this machine
customer_reviews.text: This is my first GOOD sewing machine, and I am hooked. I started sewing as a hobby in 2012 and it quickly turned into a full time job. I have worn out half a dozen cheap machines since then. I am so happy to finally have a great quality machine that purrs.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and amazed at how solid it feels. Replaced my old Brother's Innov-is 40 that died after 10 years. This Janome feels like a workhorse. The bobbin is so easy to thread. It sews like a dream. Perfect beginner sewing machine.
customer_reviews.author: Smartie81

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box I loved this machine! I took the time to read the manual to insure I got things right...especially threading the machine and winding and setting the bobbin...the drop in bobbin is a great innovation. All three of these tasks were accomplished with ease as the simplicity of the design greatly facilitates eliminating mistakes. I spent alot of time 'playing' with the machine to familiarize myself with the different stiches and was impressed with the staightforward ease of operation. The stiches are consistent and respond to adjustment. Overall function is excellent from hemming to construction. I am very pleased with this sewing machine!
customer_reviews.author: P. Hewett

customer_reviews.title: It feels very sturdy, and it has been very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a really lovely sewing machine. It feels very sturdy, and it has been very easy to use. I love the drop in bobbin. I enjoyed all of the accessories included with this package (especially the muffling mat). All in all, I am very pleased with this machine and it truly has been a dream to use.
customer_reviews.author: Cephalopod

customer_reviews.title: I'm an old Singer user
customer_reviews.text: Having learned to sew in home ec in the 50's, and making my clothes then, I was hesitant to try a new brand sewing maching. After exhaustive search I purchased the Janome Magnolia 7318 and couldn't be happier. It has enough of the manual operations that I am familiar with and the automated operations are easy to learn. I have purchased additional feet; It has done everything I have asked it to do and I am getting better and better with practice.
customer_reviews.author: Cinder

customer_reviews.title: ... to operate a bit quieter but it does a good job. The price was good
customer_reviews.text: I expected the machine to operate a bit quieter but it does a good job. The price was good.
customer_reviews.author: E. Riordan

customer_reviews.title: I think this is a great machine for the money and for my fairly simple ...
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great machine for the money and for my fairly simple sewing needs. I bought a walking foot and am also doing some simple quilt designs with it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sleep

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a great beginner sewing machine. The only real problem I had with it was the motor won't run below a certain speed making delicate work kinda iffy. Otherwise it is good for the price, but be prepared to want a better machine fairly soon if you do a bunch of sewing.
customer_reviews.author: Dinnerplate

customer_reviews.title: Sew perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't sewed since high school, almost 40 years ago. I was looking for a machine to be able to do some simple quilt projects. The Janome Magnolia 7318 is perfect! I was able to take it out of the box, follow the diagrams right on the machine for bobbin winding and threading and was sewing within 20 minutes. It goes easily through several layers of cotton and batting. This machine is great!
customer_reviews.author: GypsyLady

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a novice sewer
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a novice sewer, I just completed my first rag quilt and it hummed along like a dream the whole time. I do not sew anything complex, so can't comment on that, but it does the basics well, is easy to use and the instructions were easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Breeanna S Prata

customer_reviews.title: Great little sewing machine
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I have been happy with it for the length of time that I've owned it. It gets regular use and I have had no issues thus far. I recommend this product to anyone who is learning how to sew!
customer_reviews.author: akaruiona

customer_reviews.title: Four years so far!
customer_reviews.text: Had it four years now and it's been fantastic! I'm a self taught sewist, this is my first and hopefully only machine! Over the years I've used this for halloween costumes, dresses for my daughter, baby booties, hats, hemming, other alterations, gifts, pencil cases, bags... with all sorts of fabric, denim, felt, silk - it's a work horse. (Buying and edge guide foot for it now, to get some nicer hems with less concentration - that should speed things up for me... if only I'd known there was such a thing sooner!)
customer_reviews.author: knockknock

product_meta.title: Janome Magnolia 7318 Sewing Machine
product_meta.description: Style:Janome Magnolia 7318 Sewing MachineThe Janome Magnolia 7318 has wonderful features including 18 Built-In Stitches, a Top Loading Bobbin System, 4 Step Buttonholes and more! The Janome 7318 is an easy to use powerful machine. The perfect machine for all of your projects: from quilting, garmets, crafting, home dec and more. The Janome 7318 has 18 Built in decorative and utility stitches including a 4 step buttonhole. The convenient stitch panel on the front of the Janome 7318 shows you all the stitches at a glance with their corresponding stitch letter. The Janome 7318 is a easy to use machine even for the beginner sewer. Just turn the dial to the selected stitch indicated on the convenient stitch panel on the front of the machine. The Janome 7318 allows you to adjust the width and length of stitches to whatever you like! The Janome 7318 has a large easy to use reverse lever. Great for reinforcing your stitches. The 7318 has convenient measurement marking on the needle plate. The seam guides on the needle plate help you to measure seam allowances. The bobbin cover is see through to let you see if you are running out of thread! In addition, if you sew of the edge of the fabric it is jam proof. The Janome 7318 is a powerful and precise machine that will give you the power you need plus the precision you demand. Free motion quilting to old fashion darning is easy with the drop-feed system. No hard to use darning plates, just push the drop feed switch over and the feed will drop. Do pants legs and shirt sleeves with this feature! Just take of the free-arm off by sliding it to the left and your ready to go. Just press the button and the foot falls off, lower the shank onto the foot and the foot snaps on! No more screwing and unscrewing feet on and off. The Janome 7318 has a storage compartment conveniently located the free arm. Great for holding your included accessories. With the Janome 7318 you can fit multiple layers fabric or bulky fabrics under the presser foot with ease!
feature_bullets: Top loading jam proof bobbin system for tangle free sewing
7-piece feed dog which ensures precision fabric control
110-volt machine, for use in US only

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars266 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
